items: Stand or sit with your back straight and shoulders relaxed.
Slowly tilt your head to the right, bringing your ear towards your shoulder.
Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in the left side of your neck.
Slowly bring your head back to center.
Repeat the stretch on the left side, tilting your head to the left and holding for 10-15 seconds.
Bring your head back to center and slowly roll your head forward, chin to chest.
Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in the back of your neck.
Slowly roll your head back, looking up towards the ceiling.
Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in the front of your neck.
Bring your head back to center and repeat the sequence as desired.
Relieves tension and stiffness in the neck muscles
Improves range of motion in the neck
Reduces headaches and neck pain
Increases blood flow to the neck and head
Can be done anywhere, anytime, without equipment
Neck muscles
Trapezius muscles
Levator scapulae muscles
Sternocleidomastoid muscles
Neck Flexion Stretch
Neck Extension Stretch
Neck Lateral Flexion Stretch
Neck Rotation Stretch
Seated Neck Stretch
Standing Neck Stretch
Wall-Assisted Neck Stretch
Partner-Assisted Neck Stretch
